revised_title: The Role of Temporal Features in Speech Processing and Linguistic Contrasts
tldr: This article explores the importance of temporal information in speech processing and its role in linguistic contrasts. The authors propose a three-way partition of the temporal structure of speech based on dominant temporal fluctuation rates: envelope, periodicity, and fine-structure. They discuss the acoustic, auditory, and perceptual correlates of these features and their impact on segmental cues to manner of articulation, voicing, vowel identity, and prosodic cues.
